alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 7:09PM EST until December 24 at 10:32AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Baker River At Rumney affecting Grafton County. Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. For the Baker River...including Rumney...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Warner River...including Davisville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Baker River at Rumney. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Riverside campsites flood. At 9.0 feet, Multiple campgrounds become completely flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM EST Friday was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
